cab.content: With reference to the attached Statement, it should he noted that in the case of only very'few articles will the United Kingdom, so far as can be foreseen, be com-polled to draw supplies from our present enemies in the period immediately following the conclusion of peace.On Germany we shall probably be to some extent dependent for essential supplies ofPotash and potash manures (though we are developing other sources of supply).Chemicals and drugs of certain descriptions.Coal tar dyes, certain kinds,Glass and glass bottles.Painters1 colours.Germany is and will probably remain dependent cn the United Kingdom for a certain amount of Herrings. -Wool, -and on other parts of the Empire forand onTurkey for Valonia*Mohair.Opium.Jute,WoolCoir.Asbestos.Tin,Hides and skinseRubber,Cotton (certain sorts).Palm kernels.RiceSoard of Trade,13th April, 1917. tradj.1 of til"!- british y$?m ..7th&mm, auothia - imam m thriftin 1913.Detailed Statements showing the Value of the ^rincroal Articles imported into and exported from' the United Kingdom, the Self Govern-in^: Doniniono, tho Indian Empire etc., In 1913.Fiyst series..
